item.title: C. add a quote by Janet Frame
item.description: "A writer must stand on the rock of her self and her judgment or be swept away by the tide or sink in the quaking earth: there must be an inviolate place where the choices and decisions, however imperfect, are the writerâ€™s own, where the decision must be as individual and solitary as birth or death." -- Janet Frame

item.title: C. add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Fiction that adds up, that suggests a "logical consistency," or an explanation of some kind, is surely second-rate fiction; for the truth of life is its mystery." -- Joyce Carol Oates
